response: narrative=Kate Connolly, a 10-year-old foster child, was reported missing from her home on Craigour Road, Torphins. Prior to her disappearance, she was supposed to attend extracurricular activities but never arrived. Her last known whereabouts before vanishing were near Carmelite Street, Banff, as reported by her friend Ross Whitehead. Authorities concentrated their search around potential locations including Seafield Circle, Buckie, and address checks at 14 East Park, Inchmarlo. After several days, Kate was safely traced by police in Banchory on Inchmarlo Road. The circumstances leading to her temporary absence remain unclear.

narrative=Kate Connolly was reported missing from her home on Craigour Road, Torphins. She had exhibited noticeable personality changes prior to her disappearance. Friends, including Peter and Georgina Yates, mentioned Kate's interest in camping, possibly contributing to her unexpected disappearance. Alerts were issued following her disappearance due to her age and foster care status. The search led authorities to believe she was located near a cemetery. During an intensive search operation, Kate was finally found at 10 Garden Wood, Inchmarlo, a site known to be frequented for camping activities. Trace operations by police confirmed Kate had been in the area with a group of friends who were similarly interested in outdoor adventures, thus explaining her temporary absence.
